challenges.title: Introduction to CSS
description:
Cascading Style Sheets (CSS) tell the browser how to display the text and other content that you write in HTML.

Note that CSS is case-sensitive so be careful with your capitalization.

There are three main ways to apply CSS styling.

You can apply inline styles directly to HTML elements with the style attribute.

You can place CSS rules within style tags in an HTML document.

You can also write CSS rules in an external style sheet file, then reference that file in the HTML document.

You apply these CSS styles or rules by targeting some part of your HTML.

A CSS selector is used to do this targeting.
The style or rule is a defined property followed by a value.

challenges.title: Documentation for CSS
description: You will need documentation for CSS.
The best documentation for CSS is found on the Mozilla Developer Network (MDN). You can find the MDN docs here (developer.mozilla.org CSS)
You need to get very familiar with this site.
Try it out. Go to the CSS docs and look for the definition of the background-color property.

challenges.title: ** Read CSS The Definitive Guide 1 through 20
description:
It is recommended that you read the chapters 1 through 20 of the book:

CSS The Definitive Guide

by Eric Meyer
Please commit to reading chapters 1 through 20 before you reach the Beginning Javascript lessons.

This book should be your primary focus. However, secondarily we recommend

CSS Secrets by Lea Verou
